course_description: A beginner-level technical programming course designed to equip learners with foundational Python skills. Topics include syntax basics, data types, control structures, functions, and file handling, supported by hands-on coding exercises and real-world examples.
course_overview: This course begins with Python fundamentals such as variables, loops, and conditionals, using examples like building a simple calculator and automating file renaming tasks. Students will progress to creating functions and modules, with projects including a to-do list application and a basic web scraper. The curriculum covers data structures (lists, dictionaries, tuples) through practical applications like analyzing sales data, and introduces error handling and debugging techniques via a temperature conversion tool. A final project involves developing a weather forecast application using public APIs, reinforcing integration of concepts like loops, functions, and external libraries. The course emphasizes problem-solving and iterative development, ensuring learners can apply knowledge to scripts for data processing, automation, and small-scale applications.
target_audience: Aspiring programmers with no prior coding experience, STEM students seeking foundational programming skills, and professionals from non-technical fields aiming to automate workflows.
learning_outcomes: Define core Python syntax elements and data types including integers, strings, and booleans
Build command-line applications using control structures and functions
Analyze and debug simple Python scripts using debugging tools and techniques
Create and manipulate data structures such as lists, dictionaries, and tuples in practical scenarios
Implement file reading/writing operations for data storage and retrieval
Design modular programs by organizing code into reusable functions and modules
